name: wheat grain production | straw | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15803/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of wheat grains, at standard water content required for storage (14.5%). The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 2.86 t/ha. The data are representative for spring-seeded wheat grown in western Canada, which accounts for 80% of wheat production in Canada. Amount of seeds, pesticides and machinery use is valid for Saskatchewan (central Canada). Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 75-25-5 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 3.01 m3/ha of liquid manure and 2.14 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 0.5 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of spring wheat produced in Canada amounts to 13% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing spring wheat produced in Canada for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.5 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of grains and their transport to the farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation (a mixture of no tillage and minimum tillage), sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, making and loading bales, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'wheat grain' is calculated to be circa 3.81E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.62E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category 'Other cargo' accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions of transport by rail and inland waterways.
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category 'Other cargo' accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.

5.70293911826e-07 from Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
-8.70013995801e-08 from Wheat grains, heavy metals uptake model
-1.9833449965e-07 from Wheat straw, heavy metals uptake model
Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.
Calculated value - 100% emission in soil. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

flow.name: transport, freight, lorry, unspecified
flow.category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/492:Other land transport/4923:Freight transport by road

defaultProvider.category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/492:Other land transport/4923:Freight transport by road

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of wheat grain is calculated to be circa 1.75E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'phenoxy-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.50E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
Calculated value - Prasuhn (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0017 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Troy McInnis., Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Troy McInnis., Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 5.0 kg/ha
